intro: Rorella lusitanica, commonly known as the Lusitanian rorella, is a flowering plant native to the Iberian Peninsula. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Its slender stems and compound leaves make it a distinctive member of its genus. Rorella lusitanica is often found in Mediterranean climates and is valued for its ornamental appeal.
